page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: THE ROAD FROM ASHBOURNE TO DERBY IS NUMBERED A52.THE SECTION IN BLOCKS 04440320 AND 04430321 IS AN OLD TURNPIKE ROAD CONSTRUCTED IN THE EARLY 19TH CENTURY.THE A52 IS USED AS AN ALTERNATIVE ROUTE TO THE BUSIER A6. THERE ARE FIVE DIFFERENT TYPES OF TRAFFIC USING THE A52 ROAD. 1.LOCAL TRAFFIC TO AND FROM ASHBOURNE. 2.PEOPLE WORKING OR SHOPPING IN DERBY. 3.THROUGH TRAFFIC TO MANCHESTER AND LIVERPOOL. 4.QUARRY TRAFFIC FOR LIMESTONE PRODUCTS 5.HOLIDAY TRAFFIC DURING THE SUMMER. CHILDREN FROM OSMASTON PRIMARY SCHOOL DID VEHICLE COUNTS FOR ONE HOUR AT 8AM AND 5PM.THE RESULTS ARE AS FOLLOWS:- 8AM TO DERBY 230. TO ASHBOURNE 180 5PM TO DERBY 299. TO ASHBOURNE 357 21% WERE COMMERCIAL VEHICLES.
